result.execSummary:
The defendant Trail Marquest Leland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: in lieu of $518 costs; Consecutive to 1 year sentence w/Huber

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trail Marquest Leland

Defendant Trail Marquest Leland in court in custody with attorney Sean Drury.  Scott H. Dirks appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deft pleads Guilty freely and voluntarily; Court accepts plea and finds Deft Guilty; PSI WAIVED.
Court orders: 1 year RCJail, Consecutive to 11CF2807; w/Huber; $518 costs--11 days Jail in lieu of costs. 103 days credit.
